reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Incredible service, better than in some of the 5 star hotels we stayed in during our honeymoon in Indonesia. We stayed in the wooden room and found it quite dark and the bathroom definetely needed an update. The basin was cracked and we couldn't use the big bath; we tried to use it twice and the hot water run out. Maybe we were unlucky with the room? I don't know. The view from the terrace was amazing though. I would go back, but I would book one of the newer rooms.
reviews.title: 5 star service, room needs to be updated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, a nice experience, top notch service.
reviews.title: Thank you, TripAdvisor!

likes.disliked: — Difficult access to Internet and the grounds of the hotel

reviews.title: 3 Star price with 6 Star service
reviews.text: Thank you Trip Advisor for this recommendation! My girlfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights. It was the perfect launching point to explore Ubud and an ideal place to relax before heading out for the day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the 2 story Duplex. It was impeccably clean and the staff did an excellent job of providing quality room, laundry and maid service. The bedroom had 2 large windows which each opened onto balconies perfect for watching the sunrise on one side and sunset on the other. We had breakfast delivered every day - it was simple but fulfilling (fruit or juice and an egg dish). The room overlooked the lush rice paddies which allowed for a unique hotel experience and counteracts the mediocre grounds of the hotel itself. As for replenishing the cheap snacks, food or beer, the staff is happy to accommodate and will deliver anything you want to your room.
reviews.title: Another amazing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those looking for an active nightlife, Ubud is not your place. We enjoyed a few nice dinners (I recommend the all-you-can-eat buffet at Kutet’s Place), but the bars close around midnight and the hotel is nowhere near any action. I would not recommend this place for people looking to party, but it's great for those looking for a quiet, inexpensive spot that's walking distance to downtown Ubud and the Monkey Forest.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay at Tegal Sari

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: If you want to see the real Bali, stay at the Tegal Sari.
reviews.title: If you want to see the real Bali, stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008
reviews.text: Located about an hour's drive from the airport, it is just outside Ubud in the cultural center of Bali.
reviews.title: Incredible nice place and staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed here for three nights in January 2008, then proceeded on to stay 3 nights at the Ritz Carlton in Bali. Before the first day at the Ritz was over, I hated it so much I was ready to go back to the Tegal Sari in Ubud. There is simply no comparison. The Ritz sux. The Tegal Sari rules.
reviews.title: Loved Tegal Sari

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the Tegal Sari is genuinely friendly, and they go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. I do have to say the rooms are not the nicest I have stayed in (they are fine, just don't expect a 5-star hotel room - you are on a rice field, so expect a few bugs from time to time), but the experience and people are what make it special. The view from most of the rooms overlooks a rice field, and you can easily walk into Ubud for food and shopping. The staff will also drop you off and pick you up anywhere in Ubud at no charge, on your schedule.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Tegal Sari also owns a spa which is a short 3-minute drive away (they take you there), which is also very good and inexpensive ($10 or less per hour massage).
reviews.title: Great room and service

likes.liked: — Friendly staff (good service), Food, Clean rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights at Tegal Sari, first 2 nights in Room 23 Super Deluxe. Couldn't get it for the 3rd night so moved to Deluxe Room 17 which still a great view of the rice fields.
reviews.title: All the reviews are spot on!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's so many reviews on this hotel and it turned out to be everything we expected.
reviews.title: great atomsphere, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great location, beautiful hotel.
reviews.title: Loved Ubud and Loved Tegal Sari

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010
reviews.text: Only thing I guess they could change is to perhaps put t.v.'s in the room, for people with children. At night there is nowhere to go in Ubud after dinner so a t.v. (with cable) in the room for afterwards wouldn't go astray.
reviews.title: Tegal Sari is as great as they say

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010
reviews.text: Didn't want to leave!
reviews.title: Only one problem in a beautiful hotel.
I dream of Tegal Sari
reviews.text: I've been going to Bali for the past several years, and have brought many friends on various trips. I have stayed in a lot of places around Ubud and the rest of the Island and have ever had the experience with staff that I have had at Tegal Sari. So many memorable experiences, but one of the best was when a staff member, Astana, invited us to his "home village" for the annual temple ceremony. It was such a beautiful magical night, and I will never forget it. But it's the attention to detail, the staffs amazing ability to intuit what is needed, and their professionalism. The staff have shared the reasons that they love working there and have stayed despite the fact that they can make more money in other hotels, They are each trained to do all the jobs, which they love. The hotel is Balinese owned (some of the workers are related to the owner) and so their Holidays are honored (many hotels do not honor this.)

reviews.title: Hands down the best value for money in Ubud!
reviews.text: I could go on and on..I will just say that it is beautiful, relaxed, the pool is gorgeous and will refresh your soul. The spa is amazing. I love it there!

reviews.title: Good, not great.
reviews.text: We looked at so many places in Ubud and none of them compared to the value that Tegal Sari offers.

reviews.title: Excellent experience
reviews.text: The view, the beds, the delicious food, efficient and polite service, the smell of citronella in the rooms..........

reviews.title: Good service and friendly staff
reviews.text: Everything about it was perfect for our 7 night stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: After spending a few days in Seminyak, Ubud was amazing. This hotel is one of the best hotels in all of Bali. Everyone is soo freindly and welcoming. I will definelty stay again when I go back. But some advice....BOOK EARLY!! As all the good rooms will be taken very quickly.
reviews.title: An absolute Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: very relaxing, great staff, and great location, good food too!
reviews.title: Great experience!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: book the deluxe room with awesome paddy field view.
reviews.title: Excellent and it's the Best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Go to the restaurant Bebek Bengil too! Right nearby.
reviews.title: Pure Charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Attractions are nearby.
reviews.title: Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We just returned from an 8-day trip on Bali. Our first three nights we spent at Tegal Sari in Ubud. The hotel is very popular, so, even though I made reservations in advance, the kind of room I requested (Super Deluxe Room) was available only for the last of the 3 nights. So, the first 2 nights we had to settle for a more modest room (Superior Room). The hotel was the only one of the four hotels we stayed in that charged the full amount at the time of reservation, i.e., a few months prior to our arrival. Its cancelation policy is rather strict, as well. Nevertheless, I believe it well worth it. The accomodations, particurly the Super Deluxe Room that we spent our last night in, are terrific. The smaller Superior Room is not bad either, it has everything you would expect from a standard hotel room, plus a balcony with an amazing view. Actually, all rooms have great view. The hotel is spread along the rice fields and the views, particularly in the morning and at the sunset are just unbelievable. The service is outstanding. The location in relation to the town is very convinient.
reviews.title: Unbelievable value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I found this accomodation on trip advisor. It was everything they had said and more, because you cannot convey the feeling in words that you enjoy when you are there. The food was great, the staff were fantastic, location beautiful, atmosphere perfect, rooms were spotless, the view is just spectacular.
reviews.title: "Just awesome"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My fifteen year old son accompanied me and enjoyed it as much as I did. I went back alone after my son returned home and just completely relaxed and soaked up the atmosphere. Absolutely the BEST.
reviews.title: Superb Service with a smile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Have been to Ubud a number of times & decided to try Tegal Sari due to good reports from Tripadvisor, so had a week here in June. Great value & can't get any closer to rice paddies!! - it is in them! Suprisingly we didn't encounter mosquito problems. The staff were extremely friendly & their services including day trips,local activities,performance organisation,restuarant,bar fridge,laundry etc. were all reasonably priced & excellent. My travelling companion broke his arm while we were there & the staff looked after his medical service & needs with care & efficiency(even had a car waiting for him on release from Denpasar hospital).
reviews.title: Fantastic! Awesome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would highly recommend Tegal Sari for a real Bali experience including Balinese hospitality,service & "smiles"!
reviews.title: Wonderful place for very reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just returned from a 3 night stay in a Superior while my 2 teenagers stayed in a Super deluxe. Thank you Tegal Sari. We will definately return.
reviews.title: Nirvana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Tegal sari is deceptive from the exteriors but inside the property they have 2 lovely villas and wooden rooms with paddy field views. i selected the villa to stay for 3 nights. it was breathtaking to all details. the villa had a kitchenette, dining, living, masterbedroom, 2 bathrooms wow, it was just so fantastic.
reviews.title: the best villa i have stayed so far, but only view was lacking
Paradise
reviews.text: room service was gr8, staff was lovely.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: all in all superb
reviews.title: Loved this Place. Tegal Sari and the Staff are amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful, peaceful hotel, facing rice fields. Staff was amazing. Loved Ubud
reviews.title: I'm ready to go back!
Great value, location and rooms
reviews.text: Great value (we stayed in 3 Ubud hotels at similar prices and this was by far the best for the price). Lovely rooms, nice and big, well appointed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, just off the junction of Jalan Hanoman and Monkey Forest road so all Ubud is handy. Nice spot in the Padi fields.
reviews.title: Honeymoon in Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Tegal Sari during our honeymoon and was delighted to find the room was even better than they potrayed in their website. The room gave us a pleasant rustic feel with a balcony overlooking the paddy fields. I am usually sensitive to dust but the housekeeping team did an incredible job that I didn't get any rashes or sneezes at all during our stay. Imagine a place where you can sleep soundly all night and awoken only by the sound of birds' chirpings and ducks' quackings.
reviews.title: A great location and very comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The bathroom was nice too but one have to be careful with the bath tub as it was placed slightly higher than the usual height.
reviews.title: Excellent Value
How NIce!
reviews.text: The location takes about 15 min walk to Ubud center but one could rent motorbike at 50K Rph from them. I had blogged about Tegal Sari in this link. http://tamciakpo.blogspot.com/2010/02/bali-trip-day-1-warung-lada-and-tegal.html

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have just returned from Bali 2 days ago 18/11/07 & spent 8 nights at the Tegal Sari. My first impression of the reception was a bit daunting as it is under thatching & looks unimpressive but all the reviews that I read here on the trip advisor are correct. This place was a dream. The rooms (super deluxe - bottom floor) were fabulously large & clean. We had the most impressive view & were literally 2.5 mts from the rice fields where we were able to watch the farmers work from dawn to dusk - & being keen photographers we had a ball. Breakfast on the verandah was a delight (banana pancakes yum) , but there is also a heavenly bakery across the road who serves scrumptious fare. A supermarket is just a little up the road & there is a wine shop out front who sells Aussie wines for the same price as Oz. The walk to central Ubud only takes 25mins & it is only a 10 minute walk to Monkey Forrest. The best thing is the staff. They go out of the way to make you comfortable & welcomed. They also give free transport drop off & pick up which we used every day for free. They were always happy to help. Internet is available with quick connections. A definite return place for me. 10 stars.
reviews.title: Tegal Sari is a dream

likes.liked: — Large size of rooms & verandah & cleanliness
likes.disliked: — The reception area needs an upgrade

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights late October. Second time this year. Friend came to Bali with me for the first time and fell in love with Bali and especially Tegal Sari. Had one of the older super deluxe rooms and was very happy with it. Staff couldn't do enough for you . Would not stay anywhere else. Warung Enak almost next door is also well worth a visit.
reviews.title: Paradise re-visited

likes.disliked: — Is a little far from main Ubud. Streets would be very dangerous at night..holes etc

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family (2 adults, 2 children- 5 & 7) have just returned from 3 weeks travelling around Bali. Our stay in Ubud was memorable especially because of the Tegal Sari. The rooms (we booked a super deluxe room online before leaving Aust.), food, ambience and service were outstanding. Thankyou TA for the tip and congratulations Tegal Sari on a job well done!
reviews.title: Best Service In Bali

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading the online reviews I was pretty confident in giving this place a try. A bit scary because you can only book the place from the website and had to prepay everything beforehand.
reviews.title: My stay at TEgal Sari ruined my whole trip....

likes.liked: — The room, View, Service, Breakfast, free pickupservice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007
reviews.text: But I must say at the end this place truly was much much better than advertised.I can safely say that this must be one of the best hotels I ever stayed in.Not just in value, but also in atmosphere, class and all out service.
reviews.title: Lovely Place - Will Stay There Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed four nights at the Tegal Sari during our three week honeymoon to Bali. We also stayed at a villa in Seminiyak, Honeymoon Guesthouse and the awesome Alam Shanti, but we LOVED Tegal Sari the best! We had room #11, a Super Deluxe at $45 USD per night. The terrace was right on the rice field, so close the rice farmers sat on our fence while contemplating their crops. There were ducks in the morning, frogs at night and the most beautiful sunsets we ever saw our whole stay in Bali. The staff was five-star, the anticipated your every need and were right there when you needed them, but yet gave you privacy as well. My husband and I both work in the tourist industry at large hotels in Maui, so we know about hotel service. Tegal Sari was outstanding. Can't recommend it enough. Try for rooms 22, 24 or 26, the upper levels of the new buildings. Awesome views.
reviews.title: Tegal Sari - A Gem in the Rice Fields

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two thumbs up for Tegal Sari.
reviews.title: Amazing value, amazing experience

likes.liked: — The location, beautiful grounds and wonderfully friendly staff
likes.disliked: — The food was ok, but not out of this world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Tegal Sari excelled on every level, and created a magical few days for us in Ubud. No need to look any further than this hotel - we searched for days and although you could pay ten times the price, you won't find something as perfect for such great value.
reviews.title: Thanks 'Trip advisor', it was the best place I stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Super Deluxe room, which was still only about £26 for the room and breakfast for the night. From the moment we arrived, the staff were professional, offered superb customer service and a warmth you can't replicate. The room was lovely - clean, a big bathroom and with a beautiful view onto the rice paddies.
reviews.title: High quality,fantastic value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a lovely stone-bottomed swimming pool, little gym and they have links with a great and good value spa. Or you can get massages by the pool.
reviews.title: Great Value for the Money

likes.liked: — The Price and Location to town
likes.disliked: — The food and the flies outside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I was really sad that I only stayed here for two days.
reviews.title: You deserve to be No. 1

likes.liked: — Room, padi field view, staff and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed at the Superdeluxe wooden room. It's actually the top half of a whole balinese Villa.The interior was all very beautifull. WIth a huge high end bathroom.Bath tub was enough for two with a view to the rice paddies.
reviews.title: Everything it is made out to be!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With so many choices of nice places to stay in Bali, it's difficult deciding where to stay. We booked 6 nights at theTegal Sari in Room #10 in the old wing. While the room itself is very simple (just like in the picture on their web site), the setting made it the perfect place for us. I was very content and happy with my choice.
reviews.title: Peaceful view of the rice paddies, excellent staff services

likes.liked: — the view and the sounds of the farmers on the rice paddies -from the 2nd floor balcony

reviews.title: Deserves the number one rating !!
reviews.text: Very beautiful, intimate ,friendly little hotel. Book well in advance to avoid being disappointed. So relaxing sitting on our verandah overlooking the rice fields - bliss :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Try to get a new room if possible. Could go on and on - but it has all been said before - so just do yourself favour and go....
reviews.title: Truly a hidden gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Heaven on earth as they say.
reviews.title: Simply the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is strange how we experienced true rest and relaxation without being bored at the same time! So different from other properties, Tegal Sari offers an exceptional 'experience package' to keep you wanting to return. Experiences like these, as echoed from other reviews, are often priceless especially on the limited days spend on vacation.
reviews.title: True Heaven on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here's how we fully enjoyed the Tegal Sari and Ubud experience-
reviews.title: Excellent small hotel in Ubud
